purpose.p: The state_type_schema identifies a type of state by specifying the criterium that shall be satisified for something to be in a state of that type. For example, a state might be defined by the presence of an identified fault in a product.

The state_observed_schema identifies an observed state and the link to the thing or things that are in the state.
Observed states may correspond to a period in the life of something when the criterium defining the state type either are or will be satisfied. States are not limited to products but may apply to activities, people, and organizations.
An observed state records that one or more items were in a defined state_type for a part of their life. The item to which an observed state applies is determined by using applied_state_assignment. An observed state may apply to products, activities, people, organizations or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this resource part.

inscope.li: definition of what is needed for a state to exist
relationship between two or more states
relationship between a state and the product, activity, people or organization that it affects

outscope.li: behaviour or history of product data capable of having state

fund_cons.p: A state type captures some unique aspect or aspects that characterise a potential observed state. Over time an item may be in a given observed state for one period and not in the observed state for another period. Different items may be in the given state for different time periods, some of which may overlap. In all these cases the state is the same, that is, it conforms with the aspects that characterise the state.
In this part of ISO 10303 such a state type is recording using the state_type entity.

State types may be specified that are composed of multiple sub-state types. A state type may be related to another state type by cause and effect when one state type causes another. State types may be ordered as sequences and may transition into another state type.
The existance of an observed state, together with the items to which it applies, are the subject of the state_observed_schema.

An observed state represents the existence of something over a period of time when it exhibits some characteristic that can be identified and is distinct from other periods when that same characteristic does not apply. The characteristics define a type of state and are defined using data types specified in the state_type_schema.

Over time, a given observed state may be associated with multiple state types. This reflects the diagnosis process where something is known to be in an abnormal state but the precise reason is not known (and therefore state type) is not known. A general state type may be asserted at first. Once investigation has revealed the more precise state type, this state type can be associated as an assessed state. Similarly other state types can be asserted as not applying.
An observed state may have occured, may be current, or may be expected to take place in the future.
An item or a set of items may exist in a state. This fact is captured using the applied_state_assignment entity.
